channel.title: BUbuisnessAndMarket
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbuisnessAndMarket, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Missouri is about to become first U.S. state to exempt stock and crypto sale profits from income taxes
item.description: Though proponents hope it can spur the economy, detractors assert that the capital gains tax repeal will primarily benefit the rich.

item.title: With the Fed in the rearview, stocks jump on signs Trump wants deals with China and U.K.
item.description: Even Bitcoin is back: It was above $99,000 this morning.

item.title: It’s the norm for the Fed chairman and U.S. president to have a meeting—Powell says he’s never asked for a sit down and ‘never will’
item.description: Jerome Powell has fought hard to keep the Fed out of political narratives, and said he would never request a meeting with President Trump.

item.title: Lidl goes upmarket with a focus on elite London postcodes as part of its aggressive $665 million U.K. expansion
item.description: The German grocer eyes 40 new stores—including in Soho and Notting Hill—as it accelerates UK growth and gains market share from rivals.

item.title: Let them eat cake! French bakeries are protesting because opening on May 1 is (possibly) against the law
item.description: France’s Labor Day bread battle pits bakers’ business needs against worker rights, as lawmakers seek clarity on a centuries-old tradition.

item.title: This CEO says employers don’t have to offer work-life balance. Why she’s wrong.
Trump says more deals will follow U.K. pact that's being announced today
Global growth bellwethers Maersk and Toyota lower guidance
U.S. stocks close higher after choppy trading in wake of Fed’s rate decision
Why Nvidia investors cheered Trump’s likely dismantling of Biden’s AI chip rules
